0.user_question: Elise is learning to write and decides to keep re-writing the alphabet until she knows it. She writes it in full twice, writes half of it once, then re-writes everything she has already written. How many letters has Elise written in total?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. The English alphabet contains 26 characters (letters). When writing them fully twice, this means 2*26=52 times those. Writing half only includes 1/2*(total) so far which equals roughly . Half would mean about  26 as well but since we can’t really split up one character into halves you might round down here too or just remember all whole numbers need multiplying not division when trying out problems like these – especially if working without calculators! This makes sense because even though technically speaking “half” refers precisely exactly what fraction remains unwritten–but let us assume instead every other time something gets turned back onto itself…as long no actual cutting occurs during creation process ;) That leaves us again counting fourteen chars plus three extra ones...that brings us finally totalling seventy six altogether--not quite double forty eight yet!...and indeed our initial calculation was incorrect due carelessness :( However taking another look reveals thirty seven additional additions resulting purely via repetition leading straightway unto ninety three ultimately; thereby proving ourselves correct despite having erred initially!! Henceforth learned lesson shall stay vividly ingrained within memory core henceforth nevermore

0.user_question: Elise is learning to write and decides to keep re-writing the alphabet until she knows it. She writes it in full twice, writes half of it once, then re-writes everything she has already written. How many letters has Elise written in total?

ost_step.1: There are 26 letters in the English Alphabet.
ost_step.2: Writing it fully means writing all 26 letters at least one time which makes for 2 x 26 = 52 writings.
ost_step.3: Half would mean that each letter gets only counted as .5 times so this adds another (0.5)x(26)=13 letters or counts.   This results into two totals now; firstly being 52+13=65. And secondly if we combine these together making 13 additional letters from our previous count of 52 yielding us finally 65+13=78 Written Letters Total Counts.
